intro: Lepidium montanum var. eastwoodiae, commonly known as the Eastwood's cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in rocky soils and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
